course.title: Urban Imaginary and Visual Culture
course.description: Explores urban imagination and modernity through different art forms: literature, architecture, cinema, photography, and painting. Topics include: modernity and nostalgia, monuments and ruins, cultural archaeology and urban mapping, public and domestic spaces, memory, freedom and new technologies. Works by Baudelaire, Benjamin, Simmel, Kafka, Arendt, Nabokov, Brodsky, Pamuk, Debord. Focus for 2014: Paris, Berlin, St Petersburg, Moscow, Istanbul and Passaic, NJ.
course.notes: Open to qualified undergraduates, VES and GSD students.
